questions.question: What does a solid yellow line on a two-lane road indicate?
choices: A no turn zone
A railroad crossing
A no passing zone

questions.question: After stopping and yielding, you may turn right at a red light unless:
choices: A no turn on red sign is posted
You are turning from a two-way street
You are turning into a one-way street

questions.question: The best way to drive through a sharp curve is:
choices: Slow down when you have entered the curve
Slow down before entering the curve
Not to change your speed

questions.question: When you see this sign, you should:
choices: Watch out for traffic entering from the right
Watch out for sudden changes in the roadway
Be prepared to merge since there are fewer lanes ahead

questions.question: What should you do if you approach a fire scene and there is an unprotected fire hose on the road?
choices: Stop or drive around the hose
Cross the hose at a speed of 15 mph or less
Cross the hose if it is not in use

questions.question: When two vehicles from different directions arrive at an intersection not controlled by signs or signals, which vehicle should yield?
choices: The vehicle that is traveling faster
The vehicle approaching from the left
The vehicle that is bigger

questions.question: At what minimum age can a permit holder obtain a basic driver's license?
choices: 18 years
19 years
16 years

questions.question: You are driving on a road with few streetlights on a clear night. If you cannot see well with your low-beam headlights, which of these actions would help?
choices: Turning on your high beams
Adjusting your instrument lights so they are brighter
Turning on your vehicle's parking lights

questions.question: When there is an oncoming car to your left and a child on a bicycle to your right on a two-way road, you should:
choices: Speed up and complete the pass as quickly as possible
Keep speed and drive between the car and the child
Slow down and let the car pass before you pass

questions.question: When you approach a school, you should:
choices: Be extra careful
Look for school buses
Look for children crossing the street
All of the above

questions.question: The following is a rule of thumb for keeping a safe following distance from other vehicles on the road:
choices: Stay back 20 feet for each 10 mph of speed
Stay back 10 feet for each 10 mph of speed
Stay back 5 feet for each 10 mph of speed

questions.question: What is the meaning of this sign?
choices: Do not enter
Yield the right-of-way to other traffic
Always stop completely and yield to other traffic

questions.question: Poor visibility conditions greatly affects your:
choices: Braking distance
Perception distance
Condition of brakes

questions.question: The most considerable risk with airbags is:
choices: That they inflate too slowly
That you might be sitting too close
That they might explode

questions.question: When you see this sign, you must:
choices: Turn right ahead
Stay on the right side of a divider
Prepare to stop and yield

questions.question: You must never park within how many feet of a stop sign?
choices: 50 feet
100 feet
75 feet

questions.question: Why is it important not to drive with an exhaust leak or poorly tuned engine?
choices: It causes the engine to run hot
Your motor is likely to stall
You can be a victim of carbon monoxide poisoning

questions.question: When passing another vehicle, you may exceed the speed limit:
choices: If you cannot complete the pass before a no passing zone
With 10 mph on roads where speed limit is 45 mph or higher
In no situation

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: There will be fewer lanes ahead
The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways
The divided highway on which you are traveling ends ahead

questions.question: What is the meaning of this sign?
choices: There is a traffic signal ahead
The traffic signal ahead will show a red light
The traffic signal ahead is broken

questions.question: Which is true about large trucks?
choices: They need more room to maneuver
They have smaller blind spots
They have shorter stopping distances

questions.question: On a country road at night, a vehicle with high beams comes toward you. What should you do?
choices: Look down toward the left edge of your lane
Drive as closely as possible to the center of the road
Look to the right side of the road until the vehicle passes

questions.question: If holder of a special learner's permit receives a cell phone call while driving, they should:
choices: Use a hands-free device to answer the call
Slow down to at least 25 mph before answering
Not answer the call

questions.question: You have been taking medicine for a few days. You are not sure how the medicine will affect your driving. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Ask a medical professional
Ask a friend or relative for advice
Try driving for a short distance

questions.question: To reduce the risk of hand, wrist, or arm injury if the airbag is deployed, it is a good idea to grip the steering wheel by:
choices: Both hands in 10 and 2 o'clock positions
Both hands in 9 and 3 o'clock positions
Left hand only

questions.question: Reaction distance can be defined as the distance traveled:
choices: Before you see a hazard
After you see a hazard and before you hit the brake
After you hit the brake and before your vehicle stops

questions.question: If you are involved in a minor crash without injuries and if you are blocking the flow of traffic, it is your responsibility to:
choices: Move your vehicle off the roadway
Stay 50-100 feet behind your vehicle
Avoid stopping at the scene

questions.question: This sign tells you:
choices: The recommended safe speed you should use
The maximum speed you must not exceed
The minimum speed you must use

questions.question: When a stop line is present at a stop sign, drivers must:
choices: Stop only if pedestrians are in the crosswalk
Stop at the line
Stop at a point where it is possible to see clearly in all directions

questions.question: When driving beside a motorcycle, you should:
choices: Not drive in the motorcyclist's lane
Keep two feet between your car and the motorcycle
Share the same lane if the speed limit is 35 mph or less

questions.question: A drug you take will be considered illegal:
choices: If it is a prescription drug and you cannot show proof of the prescription to an officer
It is an over-the-counter drug and causes drowsiness or dizziness
If you mix it with any other drug without asking a medical professional

questions.question: Parking is not allowed:
choices: Within 20 feet of a fire hydrant
By a sidewalk
On an interstate highway

questions.question: What is the leading cause of car skids?
choices: Unsafe speed
Too much traffic
Narrow roads

questions.question: Even if you do not see other vehicles around, you should signal:
choices: Before making a turn
Before changing lanes
Before pulling away from the curb
All of the above

questions.question: Which color are regulatory road signs?
choices: Orange
Black and White
Yellow

questions.question: When you see this sign, what should you expect ahead?
choices: Falling rocks
Steep hill
Trucks entering the highway

questions.question: You approach this sign. What should you expect ahead?
choices: A detour
A winding road
A sharp turn to the right

questions.question: When you approach a traffic signal displaying a steady yellow light, you must:
choices: Stop, if you can do so safely
Slow down and proceed with caution
Proceed through the intersection before it turns red

questions.question: In New Jersey, motorists may use studded snow tires between:
choices: November 15 and April 1
December 1 and March 1
November 1 and March 31

questions.question: The New Jersey the Safe Corridors Program means:
choices: Fines are doubled on certain highways
You must wear safety belt on certain highways
Speed limits are increased on certain highways

questions.question: When may an airbag on-off switch be installed in a vehicle?
choices: When the vehicle is equipped with seat belts in all seating positions
When the vehicle is driven on rural roads only
When infants must be placed in the front seat because the vehicle has no rear seat

questions.question: School buses are equipped with yellow (or amber) flashing lights. These lights go on:
choices: When the bus has stopped
Before the bus starts moving
Before the bus stops

questions.question: Which of the following traffic violations will add more than four points to your driving record?
choices: Failure to yield right-of-way
Failure to obey stop sign
Improper passing of a school bus

questions.question: When following an emergency vehicle using sirens and flashing red lights, you must:
choices: Use your emergency flashers
Stay at least 300 feet behind
Slow down to 25 mph or less

questions.question: All gasoline-fueled vehicles registered in New Jersey must pass state safety inspection (checking for mechanical defects):
choices: Every two years
Every three years
Every year
None of the above

questions.question: Which is true about a vehicle's blind spots?
choices: Blind spots are eliminated by bigger side mirrors
Only commercial vehicles have blind spots
You cannot see these blind spots through the mirrors

questions.question: You must use your headlights:
choices: After sunrise and before sunset
When you turn off your windshield wipers
When you cannot see objects clearly due to smoke

questions.question: You may never cross a double solid yellow center line:
choices: To pass another car
To make a left turn into a private road
To make left turn from a driveway

questions.question: This is an example of:
choices: A State Route sign
A County Route sign
An Interstate Route sign

questions.question: When can you use the shoulder to pass another vehicle on the right?
choices: When the other driver signals you to pass
When passing on the left is unsafe
In no situation

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Winding road
Loose gravel
Slippery when wet

questions.question: You are approaching a stopped emergency vehicle on a multi-lane roadway. The vehicle has its emergency lights activated. What should you do?
choices: Keep your speed and avoid stopping
Turn on your headlights
Move over and proceed with care

questions.question: When driving in reverse, your speed should typically be:
choices: About 10 mph
2 to 4 mph
No less than 25 mph

questions.question: At an uncontrolled intersection, a pedestrian has entered the crosswalk. In this situation, you should:
choices: Make the pedestrian aware that you are approaching
Give the pedestrian the right-of-way
Change lane so you do not have to slow down

questions.question: This is the shape and background color of:
choices: An Interstate Route sign
A Freeway sign
A U.S. Route sign

questions.question: Penalties for altering a driver's license or presenting an altered driver's license include:
choices: Imprisonment
A fine up to $500
Six points on driving record

questions.question: A road sign shaped like this means:
choices: No Passing Zone
General warning
Right turn permitted on red

questions.question: With an examination permit, you may drive alone:
choices: To a license office for the purpose of taking a test
In no situation
Any time, except between midnight and 6 a.m

questions.question: If you are driving in fog and conditions are so bad that you can barely see the road ahead:
choices: Keep driving and flash your headlights
Pull completely off the road and stop
Slow down to 25 mph or less

questions.question: In this picture, car A may pass the vehicle ahead:
choices: Only if car B signals that the way is clear
Under no circumstances
Only if the way is clear

questions.question: You must never park within how many feet of a fire hydrant?
choices: 10 feet
20 feet
25 feet

questions.question: Which of the following is safer to drink if you want to drive afterward?
choices: 12 oz. of beer
5 oz. of table wine
1.5 ounces of 80-proof liquor
None (it is the same amount of alcohol in all)

questions.question: When a traffic signal is showing a flashing red light, you must:
choices: Stop completely, only proceed when you can do so safely
Stop and remain stopped until a green signal appears
Slow down and be especially alert

questions.question: New Jersey seat belt law requires that seat belts must be used by:
choices: Only the driver and passengers under 18 years
Driver and all passengers
Only the driver and front seat passengers

questions.question: You approach a railroad crossing. Red lights are flashing. Where should you stop?
choices: At least 15 feet, and not more than 50 feet from the nearest track
At least 30 feet but not more than 50 feet from the nearest track
At least 30 feet but not more than 100 feet from the nearest track

questions.question: The best way to keep from hydroplaning is to:
choices: Apply the brakes firmly
Keep your speed down
Drive at a constant speed

questions.question: When checking your blind spot before changing lanes, you should:
choices: Rely only on your mirrors
Glance briefly over your shoulder
Look over your shoulder for at least 10-15 seconds

questions.question: Your lane ends ahead, and there is a large truck in the lane beside you. What is the best thing to do?
choices: Speed up and merge in front of the truck
Stay alongside the truck and wait for the truck to slow down
Slow down and merge behind the truck

questions.question: You may only overtake another vehicle on the right on a two-lane, two-way roadway if:
choices: The vehicle you are passing is about to stop
The vehicle you are passing is about to make a left turn
You use the shoulder

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a highway, you must:
choices: Slow down because the lane ends ahead
Watch for workers and equipment ahead
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead

questions.question: When turning left, you should:
choices: Signal at least 100 feet before the turn
While waiting to turn, keep your wheels pointed to the left
Turn as soon as possible and try to cut the corner
All of the above

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Traffic in left lane must continue straight
Traffic in left lane may turn left or continue straight
Traffic in left lane must turn left
